meanings.definition: To speak negatively about one's financial situation.
meanings.sent1: She always likes to poormouth her money problems to anyone who will listen.
meanings.sent2: Don't poormouth your salary in front of your coworkers.
meanings.sent3: He would poormouth his bank account even if he won the lottery!
meanings.sent4: Her constant poormouthing of her finances painted a bleak picture of her life.
meanings.sent5: The way she poormouthed her financial struggles made everyone feel sorry for her.

meanings.definition: A person who habitually complains about being poor.
meanings.sent1: She is known as the office poormouth because she never stops complaining about money.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a poormouth; try to find solutions instead of just complaining.
meanings.sent3: The poormouth at the party made everyone laugh with their exaggerated tales of poverty.
meanings.sent4: Being a poormouth is like carrying a rain cloud over your head all the time.
meanings.sent5: The town's biggest poormouth always finds something to grumble about.
